title: Developer Tools Exploration
description:
Use browser developer tools to find specific elements and add required attributes.

## Requirements

1. Add an `id` attribute to the main heading: `id="main-title"`
2. Add a `class` attribute to the navigation: `class="site-nav"`
3. Add an `id` attribute to the footer: `id="page-footer"`
4. Add a `data-section` attribute to the article: `data-section="about"`

## How to Practice

In a real workflow, you would:
1. Open this page in a browser
2. Right-click elements and select "Inspect"
3. Identify which elements need attributes
4. Edit the HTML to add the attributes

For this exercise, add the attributes directly to the code below.
starterCode:
Welcome to My Site

  • Home
  • About
  • Contact

About This Page

This is a practice page for learning developer tools.

Copyright 2024

testCases.description: The h1 element should have id="main-title"
The nav element should have class="site-nav"
The footer element should have id="page-footer"
The article element should have data-section="about"
Page structure should remain intact (header, main, footer)
testCases.assertion: document.querySelector('header') !== null && document.querySelector('main') !== null && document.querySelector('footer') !== null

hints: Add id="main-title" inside the opening <h1> tag: <h1 id="main-title">
Add class="site-nav" inside the opening <nav> tag: <nav class="site-nav">
Add id="page-footer" inside the opening <footer> tag: <footer id="page-footer">
Add data-section="about" inside the opening <article> tag: <article data-section="about">
Attributes go inside the opening tag, before the closing >
